pullrequest.title: Fix for adding links after a model has been constructed

content.raw:
> I was also confused about how you could add a skeleton without to a world without specifying which world, but if you’re just updating a Skeleton that’s already in a world, then it makes sense that you don’t need to specify the world.

The skeleton is assumed to have already be in the `models` container. That’s how I retrieve the model, and from the that, the world of the skeleton. I think it’s a valid assumption, but like [these comments](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/29/feature-system-part-6-features-for/activity#comment-75825573), the look-ups can throw.
content.html:
I was also confused about how you could add a skeleton without to a world without specifying which world, but if you’re just updating a Skeleton that’s already in a world, then it makes sense that you don’t need to specify the world.

The skeleton is assumed to have already be in the models container. That’s how I retrieve the model, and from the that, the world of the skeleton. I think it’s a valid assumption, but like these comments, the look-ups can throw.
